looks good and there is matchmaking online. only thing i dont like focus.it feels it counters fundamentals and you can just easily focus.idk.its just me.ultras i feel people can just use it and the helath bars will be even again the next round is not affected at all by this except who wins.the super metter i feel does better because it carries over.ultra is spam it on an opening and youll get full damage without really earning it.it feels cheap now the negatives(oh boy). this game is insanely precise in execution on almost everything and online is functional and can be good at times,but it handicaps you because the links for combos have to be pressed at such a precise moment, even on beginner things & fluidity can make you drop things and be inconsistent because it feels weird compared to offline(get friends with good conenctions,recommended)there is no story unless you care about the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ arcade mode that is no where as good as mk9.no tutorial on how to play the game and many things and secrets the game wont tell you like option selects,plinking,etc.trials dont show you anything,just do moves.who are these characters,and barely any content to do in the game.its mostly barebones meaning all you have is endless, ranked, & training room.the other modes no one is using them.you have a replay channel,but since online is inconsistent sometimes,it can be hardly a prize.the ♥♥♥♥ed up part is that in omega mode,its allot easier to do all these combos because you have a bigger window and more accuracy and consistency to press the button to continue the combos(sfv combos feel like omega).its not insanely precise and you dont have to wait for the animation to finish. trust me, these things that should be easy when you learn them are hard as ♥♥♥♥.ive been using cammy for a long time and i refuse to believe that the game tells me i cant do crouching jab, jab, strong into spiral arrow because of online.thats unnacepptable.another thing is that this game was supposed to be optimized just like the consoles,what i mean is that when you practice on pc and then go play on consoles(except ps3 because i think pc is similiar to it when i played on that console) where the tournaments are on, everything is delayed and feels weird when you do your things, but spend enough time, youll get use to it. i thought it was impossbile, but i actually ended up doing pretty well in a tourney from home with pc to tourney with xbox 360. i spoke with combofiend and he said it was already established or to stay that way by capcom themselves. thats why they didnt change usf4 to make it easier like omega mode or make the pc version exactly like the consoles. that is ♥♥♥♥ed up! another thing i should tell you is that when you go online to fight someone, there is no way for you to know if youll have a good connection or a bad one because the bar rating which is black to green bars and in between, fluctuates. in green bars you might have a bad or a good connection, red,orange,black,etc. the only way to know the connection is to play that person once and sometimes its hard to really know just by one match because the game itself even offline is so precise already.this is why most tourney players dont consider online no where as steady as offline because its too easy to drop things and it constantly changes from the real thing which is offline where tournaments are played.you have to rely stuff like double tapping and p linking in order to not drop your moves instead of just simply doing the moves without doing such unneccessary execution! you feel your fighting the game itself rather than your opponent(like combofiend said lol!) there is no reason for you to make a game so hard when people will look for somthing hard to do in the game anyway! If i know how to do something i know how to do it!knowledge should always beat execution.ALWAYS BEATS EXECUTION!PERIOD.Also if your looking for good tourney players like me and others who know what they are doing with option selects,secrets,expliots, tech, and everything,good luck trying to find them on pc(consoles less hard though) because its hard to find them and youll find mostly people who do random stuff because they dont know any better and you even lose to them because of bad connection.this sucks!also the point system and matchmaking is bs.you have people who are over 10000 BP and all they did was do random moves you cant react to online.the ranking and point system is inconsistent it makes dummies look like pros.if this doesnt tell you how inconsistent online is,idk what does. i sometimes get discconected in matches,from steam in training,and even for winning one round in 2 out of 3.even sometimes the game freezes in lag spikes while playing & also keeps putting me with people that have lower points than me when i put more skilled in my settings which is suppose to put ones with higher points than me.WTF!?I even wanted to be #1 cammy and train hard for it, but why should i go through these problems anyway if online couldve been better fixed? it like walking for hours instead of waiting for a car that shouldve picked you up,but didnt when they were supposed to. its disapointing cause i really wanted to do it.anyway if you want this game get it at the lowest sale if your not sure,but i wouldnt recommend it if you have console.this game might die most likely & sfv is around the corner(if you want,get sfv instead)even if you have the game on console and want it on pc,just play it on console already unless you really want it. not much is differentthis is a fun game when you know what your doing,i just personally feel this game couldve been better with the things ive mentioned fixed, more things, easier inputs etc. i cant recommend this game to new people or even ones experienced from other games.there is just so much they have to do to get started like watch youtube videos on option selects,characters,etc.that its really a commitment your doing in order to be good at it.VERDICT: pc: 5/10 average console: 6/10 above average(pc has more problems online)i hope sfv is better than usf4 and improves on everything from the previous game and becomes great.get sfv if you dont want usf4,but if your going to get usf4,get it at least for the challenge.my experience was a struggle,but i wanted to try other games because i felt its good to have more knowledge from them and i was right.the decision to purchase the game is yours.the reason i dont give a thumbs up is because i dont reccomend this game at full price especially with dlc costumes because we all know capcom is so good at doing those things and whats mentioned,so its pretty fair i do that.Also i understand that things take time to get better at what your doing, but i think allot of people would agree with me that some things in the game didnt have to be what they are already.ive met people that have gotten frustrated over this game and left.those players i wouldnt balme them and they arent wrong either because capcom designed it that way.mkx and skullgirls are hard when you want to be really good at them,but they have allot better welcoming and comfort for those not that experienced.usf4 has nothing to offer to welcome outsiders.its horrible at tha area,but i guess that why sfvs looks like its going the way its going huh.(sigh) man i miss the old capcom.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												Street fighter is a game that has far exceeded my expectations. I initially bought this for a blast in the past game that would give me something to play actively for fun; however, I did not expect the amount of mechanics that players would have figured out by now. There is so many more techniques and data you need to learn to be good at this game. There is Frame Data, Charge Buffering, Combo + Cancelling, and many more techniques. For the price this game is definitely worth it. Keyboard, gamestick, or gamepad all can be customized to be an enjoyable experience. Definitely would recommend this game to anyone I know.

												Fun game, especially for local versus play. But going online pits you against players that seemingly know every single trick of the game and they can dish out combo's that just take you down in one go. The skill level was just way too high, matchmaking really seemed off. I'm actually torn between a positive/negative review. It's definitely fun for a short while. But as you go along, multiplayer is the only way to get a real challenge but because that's immediately way out of the league for most people, I wouldn't recommend this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												I really liked super street fighter 4 when it used to be on windowslive. It had a big player base even on pc and i could always find people in roughly the same skill range with good connection. Now that we moved to stramworks, the ultra update has hit pc and we had a couple of updates as well i feel i have spent enough time to write this review. If you are buying this game to play online don't! it doesn't matter if you are searching for "same skill" in the lobby, you will be paired with people who have 10x more experience and player points. The player base shrunk considerably since the transition to steamworks and  the fair amount of games you do find will be full of lag spikes where the connection can deteriorate to you not being able to control your character. None of the updates helped the game in terms of online playability. You will find a hard time learning your favourite characters combos because the training system in the menu either doesn't have your character in it or it has the outdated combos and you can't even perform them in this iteration of street fighter. We were promised a fix for that as well long ago. If you would buy the game for the story mode i think you will be left dissapointed as well. Since this game have been desinged to be an Arcade game the story is about 3 cutscenes per character one about their origin one for their rivals  and another for what they accomplished at the end. The boss is the same, and when you  go through a rival with a newly introduced  character from super street fighter 4 they won't even have a cutscene for the event. It's just sad really.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												Coming from a background of 3D fighters only, this game was extremely difficult to get into. I have SSFIVAE on the ps3 with over 100 hours on it and still find this game extremely diffucult. This game is worth your money ONLY IF you have the time to put into it. I would suggest you find some training parters who are experience if you are new to 2D fighters or fighters in general. If you don't, like me, you will get bodied so hard. The community is alright, people get really mad when they lose sometimes and might send you rage requests (an angry friend request). You need to learn so much if you want to find this game enjoyable online, everyone who seems to play now are either really good to the point where they spam shorykens and you can do nothing about it, really good because they abuse the lag, or really bad and cannot hadouken. Lag is pretty bad too, it cant mess up your combos or set ups. Story mode is nice.TL;DR HARD BUT FUN,  PLAY UNLESS YOU HAVE TIME

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												I really liked super street fighter 4 when it used to be on windowslive. It had a big player base even on pc and i could always find people in roughly the same skill range with good connection. Now that we moved to stramworks, the ultra update has hit pc and we had a couple of updates as well i feel i have spent enough time to write this review. If you are buying this game to play online don't! it doesn't matter if you are searching for "same skill" in the lobby, you will be paired with people who have 10x more experience and player points. The player base shrunk considerably since the transition to steamworks and  the fair amount of games you do find will be full of lag spikes where the connection can deteriorate to you not being able to control your character. None of the updates helped the game in terms of online playability. You will find a hard time learning your favourite characters combos because the training system in the menu either doesn't have your character in it or it has the outdated combos and you can't even perform them in this iteration of street fighter. We were promised a fix for that as well long ago. If you would buy the game for the story mode i think you will be left dissapointed as well. Since this game have been desinged to be an Arcade game the story is about 3 cutscenes per character one about their origin one for their rivals  and another for what they accomplished at the end. The boss is the same, and when you  go through a rival with a newly introduced  character from super street fighter 4 they won't even have a cutscene for the event. It's just sad really.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												I'd recommend this game for those looking to get into fighting games, only because its the only popular fighting game available at the moment. It's as good as you're gonna get in a 2d or 2.5d fighter now in days. Solid game mechanics and top of the line development like ALL capcom fighters. However,this game is old and outdated - being originally released in 2009 - and really hasn't improved much graphically. It annoys me to be playing this game over and over again and seeing MKX comming out soon, as a completely new game with gameplay and graphic improvements. It makes you realize how ridiculous it is to pay 30 bucks+ for a game that was developed initially in 2009. If you want to play fighting games with a great fighting engine play Street fighter 3 third strike, Fatal Fury Mark of the Wolves or Virtua Fighter 5 Final Showdown. They might not be nearly as popular as SFIV but the fighting engine in each game is 100 times better and you wont be spending your money just to spend hours playing like this..

I got the Super and Arcade editions in PS3 before moving into Steam where i got Arcade and Ultra.I love almost every character, scenery, rival battle, etc. I must have like 200 game time hours and never get bored.It´s Capcom masterpiece for old fans and new challengers as well.Pro:+ Character list+ New characters+ Graphics+ Sound+ Gameplay+ Rival FightsCon:- It takes forever to get timing right for combos, not only in challenges but practical combat.- Online is not so good.- There must be 100k Ryus online.Rating: 5/5

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												I've always had a soft spot for the fighting game genre. Starting with renting Street Fighter II Turbo from a small town video store constantly, continuing on with playing Soul Calibur II for days on end. Soul Calibur III, IV, and V all came and went, Tekken Tag, 4, and 5, were played to death... But I never really got GOOD at a game. For the most part, I mashed specials and hoped for the best vs the AI opponents.Then I finally picked up Street Fighter IV Ultra for the PC, and it was love all over again. Old characters, new characters, and finally, a game I felt like playing online.Once you finally stop playing vs the AI and begin really LEARNING with human opponents, that's where the fighting genre opens up. Nuance, strategy, muscle memory, reactions, mindgames... this game has it all.If you want a good place to start playing fighting games, you just found it.9.5/10 if you can accept losing as a part of learning.4/10 if you can't.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2016
												As a fan of Street Fighter since 2010, I can proudly say that this is is likely my favorite installment. It has a large roster of 44 characters, almost all of which are completely unique with their own play style, special moves, inputs, and ultra combos. In addition, with mods you can see legendary fights such as Hulkbuster Iron Man Vs. Link, Punished Venom Snake Vs. Alums, and a lot more. I would definitely recommend to any fan of 2D fighting games.Oh and Sagat has a ice cream alt. 10/10.
